v.v: So now, Job, I beg you, hear my speech;
See now, I have opened my mouth;
My words come from the uprightness of my heart;
The Spirit of God has made me;
If you can, answer me;
See, I am just as you are in God’s sight;
See, terror of me will not make you afraid;

v: listen to all my words.
my tongue has spoken in my mouth.
my lips speak pure knowledge.
the breath of the Almighty has given me life.
set your words in order before me and stand up.
I also have been formed out of the clay.
neither will my pressure be heavy upon you.

v.v: You have certainly spoken in my hearing;
‘I am clean and without transgression;
See, God finds opportunities to attack me;
He puts my feet in stocks;
See, in this you are not right—I will answer you,

v: I have heard the sound of your words saying,
I am innocent, and there is no sin in me.
he regards me as his enemy.
he watches all my paths.’
for God is greater than man.

v.v: Why do you struggle against him?
For God speaks once—
In a dream, in a vision of the night,
then God opens the ears of men,
in order to pull man back from his sinful purposes,
God keeps man’s life back from the pit,

v: He does not account for any of his doings.
yes, twice, though man does not notice it.
when deep sleep falls upon men,
in slumber on the bed—
and frightens them with threats,
and keep pride from him.
his life from crossing over to death.

v.v: Man is punished also with pain on his bed,
so that his life abhors food,
His flesh is consumed away so that it cannot be seen;
Indeed, his soul draws close to the pit,

v: with constant agony in his bones,
and his soul abhors delicacies.
his bones, once not seen, now stick out.
his life to those who wish to destroy it.

v.v: But if there is an angel who can be a mediator for him,
to be gracious to him and say,
Then his flesh will become fresher than a child’s;
He will pray to God, and God will be kind to him,
Then that person will sing in front of other people and say,
God has rescued my soul from going down into the pit;

v: one out of a thousand,
to tell a man what is right for him,
‘Save this person from going down to the pit;
I have found a ransom for him.’
it is restored to the days of his youth.
so that he sees God’s face with joy.
God will give the person his triumph.
‘I sinned and perverted that which was right,
but my sin was not punished.
my life will continue to see light.’

v.v: See, God does all these things with a person,
to bring his soul back from the pit,
Pay attention, Job, and listen to me;
If you have anything to say, answer me;
If not, then listen to me;

v: twice, yes, even three times,
so that he may be enlightened with the light of life.
be silent and I will speak.
speak, for I wish to prove that you are in the right.
remain silent, and I will teach you wisdom.”
